      • actionIfBallHitsBrick

                           GameObject brick)

        ball - A referene to the urrentz ball object
        brick - A reference to the ego object

      • applyGameLogic

        public void applyGameLogic()
        Models interactions between GameObjects. notably ball/ego and ball/brick.
        Specified by:
        applyGameLogic in class Playground

      • getBrickSizeX

        public abstract double getBrickSizeX()
        Controls the width of created bricks in Pixels. Is used by #createBrick.
        Returns:
        bricks size X in pixels

      • getBrickSizeY

        public abstract double getBrickSizeY()
        Controls the height of created bricks in Pixels. Is used by #createBrick.
        Returns:
        bricks size Y in pixels

      • getBrickStartX

        public abstract double getBrickStartX()
        Controls the x coordinate of the upper left point of the grid of bricks, in Pixels. Is used by #createBrick.
        Returns:
        bricks start X in pixels

      • getBrickStartY

        public abstract double getBrickStartY()
        Controls the y coordinate of the upper left point of the grid of bricks, in Pixels. Is used by #createBrick.
        Returns:
        bricks start Y in pixels

      • calcNrBricksX

        public abstract int calcNrBricksX()
        Controls the nr of bricks in the X direction. Is used by #createBrick.
        Returns:
        nr of bricks in X direction

      • calcNrBricksY

        Controls the nr of bricks in the Y direction. Is used by #createBrick.
        Returns:
        nr of bricks in Y direction

      • createEgoObject

        public GameObject createEgoObject()
        Creates the ego object and returns it, called by #prepareLevel. Does NOT add the ego object to the playground!
        Returns:
        The created ego object instance (of class EgoObject)

      • createBall

        public GameObject createBall()
        Creates the ball object and returns it, called by #prepareLevel. Does NOT add the ball object to the playground!
        Returns:
        The created ball object instance (of class FallingStar)

      • createBrick

        public abstract GameObject createBrick(int row,
                                       int column)
        Creates the GameObject (RectObject) instance representing a single brick at a certain grid position. The brick is NOT added here!
        Parameters:
        row - row position in the grid, ranges from 0 to calcNrBricksY()-1
        column - column position in the grid of bricks, ranges from 0 to calcNrBricksX()-1
        Returns:
        The GameObject instance (really a RectObject) representing the created brick.

      • prepareLevel

        public void prepareLevel(java.lang.String level)
        Prepares a generic Breakout-Type level. This method relies on the methods #createEgo, #createBall and #createBrick, among others, which are meant to be overwritten in subclasses.
        Specified by:
        prepareLevel in class Playground
        Parameters:
        level - String passes by the game engine, is in principle obsolete and can be ignored
